articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Lao Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Lao Delegation 
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Ministry of Public Security of Laos. 
					 Minister Somkeo Sylavong who is leading the Lao delegation conveyed the gift to Minister of People's Security of the DPRK Choe Pu Il on Tuesday.

articles.title: Talks between DPRK and Lao Security Organs Held
articles.content:
Talks between DPRK and Lao Security Organs Held
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- There took place talks between a delegation of the Ministry of People's Security of the DPRK and a delegation of the Ministry of Public Security of Laos at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Minister Choe Pu Il and officials of the Ministry of People's Security of the DPRK and from the opposite side members of the delegation of the Ministry of Public Security of Laos led by Minister Somkeo Sylavong and Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Phonekham Inthaboualy.
					
					 At the talks, both sides exchanged views on the issue of developing the friendly relations between the security organs of the two countries and issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Delegation of Kim Il Sung University Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of Kim Il Sung University Back Home
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Kim Il Sung University headed by Thae Hyong Chol, president of the university and minister of Higher Education, came back home Tuesday after visiting several universities of Russia.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Officials Do Friendly Work at Kochang Vegetable Co-op Farm
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Officials Do Friendly Work at Kochang Vegetable Co-op Farm 
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Alexandr Matsegora and his embassy officials did friendly work at the Korea-Russia Friendship Kochang Vegetable Co-op Farm in Chollima District on Tuesday. 
					 They helped farmers in threshing rice. 
					
					 They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Relay of Members of Young Vanguard Starts from Top of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Relay of Members of Young Vanguard Starts from Top of Mt. Paektu
						
 Samjiyon, October 27 (KCNA) -- A relay of loyal members of the young vanguard kicked off with due ceremony on top of Mt. Paektu on Tuesday on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League. Their final destination is Pyongyang.
					 Present there were officials of the youth league in Pyongyang and local areas and youth and students.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The relay group left for Pyongyang, led by the red flag.

articles.title: U.S. Human Rights Abuses Are Inevitable Product of Unethical Policy
articles.content:
U.S. Human Rights Abuses Are Inevitable Product of Unethical Policy
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The U.S. human rights abuses are shocking the world.
					 As known, U.S. forces in Afghanistan bombed a hospital in Kunduz Province on Oct. 3, killing dozens of children, patients and doctors, wounding 37 and leaving 24 missing.
					
					 This is a human rights abuse that has to be investigated and brought to justice in the name of the world.
					
					 But far from repenting of its act of massacring innocent civilians in disregard of international law, the U.S. is repeating senseless remark that it was at the request of the Afghan forces.
					
					 This is an intolerable insult and a mockery of humankind indignant at the shuddering crimes that pushed dozens to grievous deaths.
					
					 The recent barbarous bombing was an inevitable result of the hideous policy of the U.S. which resorts to every possible means and method to realize its ambition for world domination.
					
					 It was pursuant to this genocidal policy that it started wars in Grenada, former Yugoslavia, Afghanistan, Iraq and Libya and in other parts of the world and fostered civil wars, encroaching upon the right to existence of a great number of people and reducing them to refugees.
					
					 In February 1991 the U.S. bombed an air-raid shelter in Al Amiriya, Iraq, killing hundreds of civilians. In July 1988 it shot down an airliner with a missile, killing hundreds of passengers aboard.
					
					 There are countless examples of the monstrous massacres committed by the U.S. in the world.
					
					 The U.S. is the world's worst human rights abuser and an enemy common to humankind as it adopted it as its state policy to commit systematic and deliberate human rights abuses.
					
					 Irony is that this worst human rights abuser in the world is styling itself a "human rights judge", pointing accusing fingers at other countries over their human rights issues.
					
					 The U.S. has neither justifications nor a face to talk about human rights of others as it is beset with hideous human rights abuses that are commonplace in the country.
					
					 The U.S. protects by law, namely article 2 of the modified constitution, the possession of guns by individuals, the hotbed of high-profile crimes, and any attempt to check or restrict it is categorically rejected through Congress.
					
					 It is because the possession of guns and the continued free sale of them bring the U.S. no small profits.
					
					 The gun-related crimes are becoming an incurable malignant tumor in the U.S.
					
					 Even recently at a community university in Oregon State, the U.S., a shooting spree occurred, killing and wounding dozens.
					
					 In September a police man shot a black man to death.
					
					 As seen above, all human rights abuses taking place in the U.S. are a product of the corrupt money-almighty doctrine and jungle law that prevail in the society.
					
					 It is none other than the ruling quarters of the U.S. who are responsible for making society corrupt and ailing.
					
					 Denunciation and censure are not enough to put an end to the human rights abuses of the U.S. 
					
					 This is possible only when the whole world dismembers the U.S.

articles.title: Graphite Production Process at Kwangchon Mine Commissioned
articles.content:
Graphite Production Process at Kwangchon Mine Commissioned 
						
 Tanchon, October 27 (KCNA) -- A graphite production process was newly built and went into operation at the Kwangchon Mine with due ceremony on the spot Tuesday. 
					 The completion of the new production process helps lay a strong foundation for massively mining and dressing graphite found in abundance in the mine area and boosting the production of quality graphite so as to build an economic power and improve the people's living standard. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were officials concerned, officials and employees of the mine, and builders and helpers. 
					
					 Thae Jong Su, chief secretary of the South Hamgyong Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, made an address. 
					
					 At the end of the ceremony the participants went round the new production process.

articles.title: Process for Producing Poly-Iron Sulphate Goes Operational
articles.content:
Process for Producing Poly-Iron Sulphate Goes Operational 
						
 Tanchon, October 27 (KCNA) -- The new process for producing poly-iron sulphate went into operation with due ceremony at the Tanchon Smeltery Tuesday.
					 The process helps successfully produce and ensure poly-iron sulphate necessary for improving the people's living standard and developing agriculture.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Choe Sang Gon, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission, officials concerned, officials and employees of the smeltery and builders.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, they looked round the production process.

articles.title: Universities Helps Nation's Economic Development
articles.content:
Universities Helps Nation's Economic Development
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Teachers and researchers of universities in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK, have contributed to solving the sci-tech problems arising in the development of the national economy.
					 Those of Kim Il Sung University established a process of producing blast gas neutralizer needed for accelerating the waterway project in South Hwanghae Province. They also developed a new plant growth promoter and composite nutrient solution helpful to increasing the country's agricultural production.
					
					 Kim Chaek University of Technology developed a Korean-style shoal detector while Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering manufactured a new type of wind-powered generator.
					
					 Pyongyang University of Railways made valuable research findings conducive to putting the nation's railways on a normal operation.
					
					 Besides, Pyongyang University of Architecture and other universities made a lot of sci-tech achievements for the country's rapid economic progress.

articles.title: Multi-purpose Adhesive Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
Multi-purpose Adhesive Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- A technical exchange company under Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry in the DPRK developed a new multi-purpose adhesive.
					 This adhesive has been used in many fields of the nation's economy, including shipbuilding, shoe-making and foodstuff industries.
					
					 It is applicable to rubber, resin, metal, wood, stone, porcelain, etc., and it can be used at temperatures from minus 40 degrees centigrade to 150 degrees centigrade.
					
					 The adhesive was registered as one of the DPRK's patents.

articles.title: Achievements in Medical Science
articles.content:
Achievements in Medical Science
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The North Hwanghae Provincial People's Hospital in the DPRK has shown good results in medical science research while intensifying its medical service for inhabitants.
					 The hospital developed an efficacious agent for improving lipid in serum with grape abundant in the province.
					
					 It also succeeded in manufacturing Koryo (traditional) medicines for ischemic heart disease, including capsule made of grape compound, safflower and lecithin.

articles.title: Japan's Trick to Evade Redemption of Past Crimes Flailed
articles.content:
Japan's Trick to Evade Redemption of Past Crimes Flailed
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- A Japanese diplomat at the UN claimed at a recent UN General Assembly session that the issue of the "comfort women" and other past historical issues have been settled, a challenge to the international call for an apology and reparation for the hideous crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists against humanity.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says that we can not but lay bare once again the Japanese reactionaries' impudence and moral vulgarity in the light of the fact that he spoke for the government.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that the Japanese reactionaries are playing a trick to solve everything with money in a bid to evade sincere apology and reparation for the crimes against humanity.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries have resorted to the similar method when they voiced opposition to the registration of the massacre of Chinese in Nanjing as a world heritage. 
					
					 The Japan chief Cabinet secretary blustered that Tokyo would examine all possibilities including the suspension of the payment of its contribution, claiming that the truth of the document which the Chinese authorities applied to UNESCO for registration has not yet been proved and complaining the international organization is not considerate of Japan actively cooperating with it by sincerely paying its contribution to the body. 
					
					 The international community is closely looking at the Japanese reactionaries who meanly point accusing fingers at the international body over a petty amount of money when they find themselves in an unfavorable situation even though they abuse its name, when necessary.
					
					 Japan's liquidation of the past crimes is a political and moral issue and an international legal issue as it means redressing its crimes committed against humanity.
					
					 Japan can never evade its responsibility for those crimes.
					
					 Japan will only be forsaken by the international community for evading the redemption of its past wrongs.

articles.title: Minju Joson Calls for Forcing Foreign Troops to Pull back from Afghanistan
articles.content:
Minju Joson Calls for Forcing Foreign Troops to Pull back from Afghanistan 
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, U.S. President Obama made public a new plan for the U.S. forces' presence in Afghanistan.
					 According to it, the U.S. plans to keep more than 9 800 troops in Afghanistan till 2016 and have at least 5 500 service members stationed there in 2017.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary says in this regard:
					
					 The above-said fact goes to clearly prove once again its sinister intention not to give up the domination over Afghanistan.
					
					 The U.S. considers the U.S. forces' presence in Afghanistan as unavoidable, contending that this country will be put under the control of terrorists again and the blood shed by them for "peace" and "stability", "freedom" and "democracy" will be in vain in case of withdrawal of its forces under the situation where the Taliban forces are going on a rampage.
					
					 The U.S. forces brought to Afghanistan only confusion, destruction and pain, not peace, stability and prosperity.
					
					 The U.S. asserted that the U.S. forces in south Korea have played the role of preserving peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula, but various forms of military drills they staged every year and huge quantities of weaponry it introduced into south Korea only resulted in escalating the regional tension and arms race. 
					
					 Moreover, a lot of south Korean people have met grievous deaths and undergone pain owing to all sorts of crimes committed by the U.S. forces in south Korea.
					
					 Interference in internal affairs of other countries and military presence there are the root cause of wrecking peace and stability.
					
					 If the world people truly want peace and stability, they should force outside forces to withdraw from other countries to the last man, first of all.

articles.title: DPRK Scholar on Controversial "System of State-compiled History Textbook" in S. Korea
articles.content:
DPRK Scholar on Controversial "System of State-compiled History Textbook" in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities should refrain from attempted introduction of the "system of state-compiled history textbooks" and pay attention to ensuring workers' vital rights and social democracy.
					 So Song Il, director of the Socio-politics Institute under the Academy of Social Sciences in the DPRK, said this, referring to the fact that the conservative ruling forces of south Korea seek to revise the history textbooks by dint of power despite the opposition of historians, teachers and students and others.
					
					 He said:
					
					 In south Korea the living conditions of workers and peasants are getting worse due to the retrogressive revision of labor law and total opening of rice market by the chief executive. It is well evidenced by the fact that workers in Seoul and Changwon of South Kyongsang Province recently staged large-scale strikes and anti-"government" rallies.
					
					 But, the conservative ruling forces is now stepping up the scheme to introduce the "system of state-compiled history textbooks", urging the Ministry of Education to sternly cope with the Teachers Union opposing it.
					
					 The south Korean people are rejecting the introduction as a "coup d'etat against history" and a move to beautify the past "Yusin" dictatorship and the anti-social policies of the present regime.
					
					 The south Korean conservative ruling forces' scheme to revive the "Yusin" dictatorship is doomed to face a stern punishment of history.

articles.title: KCTU Calls for All-out Struggle against Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law
articles.content:
KCTU Calls for All-out Struggle against Retrogressive Revision of Labor Law
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a large meeting to check the retrogressive revision of the labor law and abolish part-time job in Seoul on October 24, according to the south Korean newspaper Nodong and Segye,. 
					 Speakers said that broad working masses including 50 000 part-time workers would launch all-people action on November 14. 
					
					 At the end of the meeting the participants staged a demonstration informing citizens of the injustice of the retrogressive revision of the labor law by the authorities and its consequences.

articles.title: Overseas S. Korean Scholars Oppose Authorities' Distortion of History
articles.content:
Overseas S. Korean Scholars Oppose Authorities' Distortion of History
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- At least 150 south Korean scholars overseas issued a statement on Oct. 25 opposing the authorities' move to introduce "state-compiled history textbooks", according to CBS of south Korea.
					 This is an extension of the regime's policy of suppressing the freedom of academic study, the statement said.
					
					 It extended solidarity and support to history professors of south Korea growing vocal opposing the regime's move to introduce "state-compiled history textbooks".

articles.title: Representative of "Saenuri Party" of S. Korea Accused of Painting His Father as "Patriot"
articles.content:
Representative of "Saenuri Party" of S. Korea Accused of Painting His Father as "Patriot"
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- An editorial accusing Kim Mu Song, representative of the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea, of trying to paint his father, a pro-Japanese lackey, as a "patriot" was posted on Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea, on Oct. 26.
					 The editorial said that Kim Mu Song asserted again before reporters that his father Kim Yong Ju listed on the "Dictionary of Pro-Japanese Elements" was a "patriot who provided funds to the independence army".
					
					 As regards this issue, the Institute for National Studies which edited the above-said dictionary made it clear that the results of the recent survey of Kim Yong Ju records confirmed his acts of treachery, the editorial said. 
					
					 It noted that intolerable are his remarks denying and distorting treacherous acts of pro-Japanese element and painting the traitor as a "patriot".

articles.title: WPK's 70th Birthday Observed by Indonesian Newspapers
articles.content:
WPK's 70th Birthday Observed by Indonesian Newspapers
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Indonesian newspapers allotted one whole page to special write-ups illustrated with a photo of supreme leader Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The Oct. 7th issue of the International Daily in its articles under various titles introduced in detail Mt. Paektu, saying that today the words revolutionary spirit of Paektu and the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu are in wide use in the DPRK, arousing an unprecedented enthusiasm to tour it.
					
					 The paper in its article titled "The spirit of the blizzards of Paektu" said:
					
					 It is the firm will of Kim Jong Un to carry forward the revolutionary spirit of Paektu on the highest level.
					
					 He climbed Mt. Paektu with smile on his face, looking down huge enemy troops when the hostile forces led by the U.S. went to extremes in their moves to stifle the DPRK. This was a manifestation of his confidence of the final victory. 
					
					 The Oct. 9th issue of the International Media carried photos of the May Day Stadium and Changjon Street under the title of "Congratulations on the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK" and edited an article titled "Invincibility of the WPK".
					
					 The paper in its article titled "Leader Kim Jong Un's pluck" said:
					
					 His declaration that the DPRK's revolutionary armed forces are ready to react to any form of war sought by the U.S. is a manifestation of his will to finally conclude the DPRK-U.S. stand-off that has lasted for several decades.
					
					 It is self-evident that the DPRK is sure to triumph as it is led by him possessed of matchless grit in case of the outbreak of a war between the DPRK and the U.S.

articles.title: WPK Praised by Foreign Media
articles.content:
WPK Praised by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups or aired special programs on the 18th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK.
					 The Oct. 1st issue of the Myanmar newspaper The New Age allotted two whole pages to a special write-up titled "Warm congratulations to HE Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK, and all Korean people".
					
					 The paper said:
					
					 The DPRK is the country where the political freedom and rights of the working class are thoroughly guaranteed legally and socially.
					
					 The DPRK enacts laws for the working class and pursues policies giving priority to them when it adopts a law and pursues a social policy.
					
					 Everybody in the DPRK enjoys happiness only free from any worry thanks to all social benefits including the free healthcare according to the party's popular policies.
					
					 The Oct. 8-14th issue of the Russian newspaper Nizhegorodskaya Pravda in its article titled "The WPK is a mass party" said that the WPK founded and led by President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il has demonstrated victories and glory only over the past 70 years.
					
					 The Cambodian newspaper Kmae Amata on Oct. 24 carried an article titled "We serve the people."
					
					 The paper said that the WPK makes it an iron rule to settle all problems, giving priority to the demands and interests of the people.
					
					 The F. M. 90.5 Radio and Apsara TV and Radio of Cambodia on Oct. 23 and 24 introduced the DPRK where the people's happiness and ideal are becoming realities under the leadership of the party.

articles.title: DPRK FM Statement Supported by Ugandan Figure
articles.content:
DPRK FM Statement Supported by Ugandan Figure
						
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Ugandan National Executive Committee of the Pan-African Movement released a statement on October 21 in support of the statement issued by the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The experience in the past period proves that even a trifling accidental case on the Korean Peninsula may be a grave challenge to the regional and world peace.
					
					 The tense situation which prevailed on the peninsula in last August finally proved that the existing AA could no longer avert a conflict and defuse the danger of a war.
					
					 It is self-evident that the discussion of any issue related to the peninsula cannot be otherwise than an empty talk and the denuclearization of the peninsula, the issue of interest of all countries concerned including the U.S., can hardly be solved unless the Korean Armistice Agreement is replaced with a peace treaty.
					
					 If the U.S. persistently pursues its hostile policy toward the DPRK and continues its military provocations such as the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises, they will chill the atmosphere of all negotiations and deteriorate the situation.
					
					 In the light of this reality we consider that only by replacing the AA with a peace treaty is it possible to preserve peace and security on the peninsula and voice full support for the above-said statement of the DPRK FM.

articles.title: DPRK FM Statement Introduced Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK FM Statement Introduced Abroad 
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- A statement issued by the Foreign Ministry of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea as regards the proposal for concluding a peace treaty was introduced in different countries and by a regional organization from Oct. 19 to 22.
					 The Bangladeshi papers Dainik Probat, The Daily Folk and The Daily Industry, ATN TV broadcasting service, the Ugandan paper The New Vision and Ugandan radio broadcasting service, a Kenyan paper, the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the South African Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, websites of the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany and a magazine of Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America introduced the full text or the gist of the above-said statement.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones de ministerios de seguridad de Corea y Laos
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones de ministerios de seguridad de Corea y Laos
						
Pyongyang, 27 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 27 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre las delegaciones del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y del Ministerio de Seguridad y Defensa de Laos.
					En la ocasion participaron, por la parte coreana el ministro Choe Pu Il y otros funcionarios del citado Ministerio y por la laosiana los miembros de la delegacion encabezada por el ministro Somkeo Sylavong y el embajador en la RPDC Phonekham Inthaboualy.
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron los criterios sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre los organos de seguridad de ambos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Tiene lugar acto de partida de carrera de relevos de fidelidad de vanguardias juveniles
articles.content:
Tiene lugar acto de partida de carrera de relevos de fidelidad de vanguardias juveniles 
						
Samjiyon, 27 de octubre (ACNC) -- Quedo iniciada la carrera de relevos de fidelidad de vanguardias juveniles en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea con motivo del 70o aniversario de la fundacion de la .Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung 
					La caravana llegara a Pyongyang despues de iniciar su marcha en el monte Paektu. 
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 27 en la cima del monte Paektu el acto de partida con la participacion de los funcionarios del centro y localidades de la UJS y los jovenes estudiantes. 
					
					El presidente del CC de la UJS, Jon Yong Nam, presento un informe de partida y otras personas hicieron uso de la palabra. 
					
					Fue concedida a la caravana la bandera roja con las inscripciones de "Espiritu revolucionario del Paektu, el de viento cortante del Paektu" y proclamada la partida. 
					
					La caravana partio hacia Pyongyang enarbolando al frente la bandera con efigies de los grandes Lideres con amplia sonrisa.
